    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound(java.lang.String name)
        Declares default variable values.
        Parameters:
        name - the name

    • Method Detail

      • nextVolumeTick

        public static void nextVolumeTick()
        Next volume tick.

      • getVolume

        public static SoundVolume getVolume()
        Gets volume.
        Returns:
        the volume

      • play

        public void play()
        Starts playing the audio in a new thread.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the audio at its current place. Calling this method once pauses the audio stream, calling it again unpauses the audio stream.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restarts the current song. Always use this method to restart a song and never .stop() followed by .play(), which is not safe.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Closes the audio stream. This method takes some time to execute, and as such you should never call .stop() followed immediately by .play(). If you need to restart a song, use .restart().

      • mute

        public void mute()
        Stream continues to play, but no sound is heard. Calling this method once mutes the audio stream, calling it again unmutes the audio stream.

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Makes a given audio file loop back to the beginning when the end is reached. Calling this method once will make it loop, calling it again will make it stop looping, but will not stop the audio from playing to the end of a given loop.

      • fadeTransitionTo

        public void fadeTransitionTo(Sound nextSound)
        Fade transition to.
        Parameters:
        nextSound - the next sound

      • run

        public void run()
        Retrieves the audio stream information and starts the stream. When the stream ends, this method checks to see if it should loop and start again.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        Returns if a file is loaded or not.
        Returns:
        File status of null or a file.

      • isLooping

        public boolean isLooping()
        Returns whether or not a clip will loop when it reaches the end.
        Returns:
        Status of the variable loop.

      • isMuted

        public boolean isMuted()
        Returns if the audio is muted or not.
        Returns:
        Status of mute variable.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns if the audio is paused or not.
        Returns:
        Status of pause variable.

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Returns if audio is currently playing (if the audio is muted, this will still be true).
        Returns:
        If the thread is running or not.
